column2: MISSOURI PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Missouri

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. To obtain a  motorcycle instruction permit a person must be ____  years or older.
2. Anything that requires you to _______ could cause you to crash.
column4: take your eyes off the road
column6: take your hands off the wheel
column8: take your attention away from driving

column2: 3. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.
column6: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column8: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column10: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn

column2: 5. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
column4: fix

column2: 6. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column6: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column10: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.

column2: 7. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column4: Pumping brakes.
column6: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.

column2: 8. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
column4: yield

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: No parking

column2: 10. Roads are most slippery:
column4: just before it rains.
column6: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 11. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: remove the sign and move forward.
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.
column10: look for a detour or another route.

column2: 12. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.

column2: 13. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.
column6: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.
column8: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control
column10: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.

column2: 14. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column4: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 15. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.
column8: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

column2: 16. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column6: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column8: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.

column2: 17. When you come to an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:
column4: stop at the intersection and wait for a flashing green light.
column6: stop only if cars are approaching the intersection.
column8: slow down and drive carefully through the  intersection.
column10: stop at the intersection, then proceed when safe and observe the right-of-way rules.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: Traffic flows only in the direction of the arrow

column2: 19. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column4: improves concentration.
column8: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column10: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: Railroad Warning

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop and yield right-of-way
column8: Always come to a complete stop
column10: Slow down and yield to traffic on main road when merging

column2: 22. Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
column4: have your emergency brake on.

column2: 23. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column4: before the traffic light turns red.

column2: 24. This road sign:
column4: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column6: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column10: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.

column2: 25. Tailgating:
column4: helps reduce traffic congestion.
column8: cannot result in a traffic citation.
column10: can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.
